author: emeliasarfo2
title: Grow Afriteen, grow Cardano ERGhana
description: O conhecimento da cadeia de bloqueio Cardano é quase insignificante entre os jovens da Região Leste de Gana, em particular.

f6_assessments.q0: Achei muito positivo que os autores da proposta argumentem a necessidade de um projeto desse tipo em Gana. É sempre muito bom ter uma contextualização do problema encontrada no local, para que as pessoas do exterior tenham uma melhor compreensão. Neste caso, os autores afirmam que mesmo os jovens com formação formal enfrentam dificuldades para encontrar um emprego, o que gera muita pressão familiar e acredito que há alguma agonia por parte desta parcela da população. Isto torna o treinamento de adolescentes e jovens sobre tecnologias relevantes para o ecossistema Cardano ainda mais urgente neste local. Acredito que, para uma parcela da sociedade que sofre tanto com a falta de oportunidades, este projeto será algo que eles entenderão com suas garras, valorizando-o, pois abrirá o caminho para o que eles estão procurando (fonte de renda). Como tal, é muito provável que esta iniciativa receba um feedback positivo, ao mesmo tempo em que beneficiará o próprio ecossistema Cardano, pois recrutará novos participantes, como é um dos objetivos do desafio. Isto também está relacionado ao desafio lançado no fundo anterior, "Grow Africa, Grow Cardano", que aumenta ainda mais o valor do projeto, porque acredito que a comunidade ainda está disposta a investir no continente, apesar de este fundo ter sido bem sucedido. Eu me concentro em outras partes do mundo, como a América Latina e o Japão. Portanto, na minha opinião, esta é uma proposta de alto impacto.
f6_assessments.q1: Os autores da proposta especificam claramente os objetivos que pretendem atingir com o desenvolvimento deste projeto, o que também nos leva à possibilidade de definir, de forma clara, as fases que serão necessárias para serem cumpridas. Os autores também estão preocupados em definir os temas abordados em cada oficina, além do número de oficinas por mês (2), mas esta parte que fala sobre os eventos poderia ter sido mais detalhada. Eles poderiam nos informar em que mês cada um deles ocorreria, onde seria sua localização exata, quem os apresentaria, seu público estimado e assim por diante. Observa-se que os autores têm fortes parcerias, incluindo o grupo WADA, que já é bem conhecido no Catalyst por lançar projetos que afetam positivamente o continente africano. Tais conexões são essenciais para garantir uma boa bagagem e apoio de qualidade para o projeto, certamente com esta equipe geral os workshops teriam um alto padrão; entretanto, gostaria que os autores tivessem informado, como disse acima, quem os apresentaria. Muito provavelmente eles têm uma lista de palestrantes em mente, mas seria importante conhecê-los, assim como conhecer melhor os próprios autores, Emelia e Afia, que nos dão uma descrição muito breve de quem eles são. Gostaria de saber um pouco mais sobre seu trabalho anterior, que caminhos eles tomaram dentro do grupo WADA (entendo que eles são membros) e assim por diante. Finalmente, no que diz respeito à divisão financeira: Achei o montante solicitado no financiamento muito razoável e é bem justificado com o projeto. Os autores explicam para que cada parcela do financiamento seria utilizada; mais uma vez, ressalto que a necessidade de maiores detalhes é necessária para aumentar ainda mais o valor desta proposta. Quando eles falam de US$ 1.500 para locação, internet e equipamento: onde seria essa locação? Como seriam aplicados exatamente os US$ 2.000 para logística? Por exemplo, de onde viriam os palestrantes para justificar tal valor? Entretanto, penso que mesmo sem um detalhe profundo, temos uma noção muito clara de como o dinheiro seria investido. Para chegar, este tópico da proposta foi bem abordado, precisa de mais detalhes, mas é bom.
f6_assessments.q2: A auditabilidade pode ser claramente exercida nesta proposta, com base nas informações que são ditas nos tópicos de sucesso e métricas de impacto. Em geral, acredito que a forma mais orgânica de entender se o projeto funcionou é se os jovens envolvidos nas oficinas estão sendo inseridos no mercado de trabalho, seja fundando seus próprios negócios ou mesmo ingressando em empresas já existentes. Gostaria que houvesse algum tipo de acompanhamento dessas pessoas, ou seja, como poderíamos manter contato com elas, a fim de estarmos cientes de suas realizações pós-evento? Poderíamos pensar em estabelecer este ponto, de repente um membro da própria WADA poderia ser responsável por isso e trazer feedback ao resto da comunidade, através da participação na prefeitura, por exemplo. Também podemos exercer a auditabilidade, monitorando os próprios workshops. Um membro da comunidade que vive em Gana poderia participar frente a frente com eles e preparar relatórios para verificar se as métricas de sucesso durante o evento estavam realmente sendo cumpridas. Estas são idéias que podem servir para realizar na prática o monitoramento das informações que a dupla já fornece, portanto, acredito que a proposta é ideal neste tópico.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal problem statement and solution are aligned with the challenge.
This proposal also clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem by educating and spreading awareness on Cardano for students in Ghana. Also, the key metrics and goals of this proposal are aligned with the outlined challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer provided evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the project. The proposer also knows the required manpower and resources to successfully implement the project. The budget presented is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable terms. Moreover, the budget requested are reasonable to achieve the set goals. Furthermore, this proposal provides a sensible and conductible plan for implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. The proposer also provided key metrics and KPI that define the success of the proposal. Moreover, the proposer provided links to their website and social media for the voters to keep track of their progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely Cardano blockchain knowledge is almost negligible among the youth in the Eastern Region of Ghana 
. 
It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief in being able to educate about 300 youth on Cardano and it's opportunities.

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
This proposal shows how it adds value to the Cardano system by being able to educate about 300 youth on Cardano and it's opportunities
 
  Key metrics  would be  number of participants,  number of completions of the course, number of participants in each course, number of feedback, number of new proposers and voters.
 

The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
   
Proposal can be scaled up to address future challenges by adding more schools and students

This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by increasing the collaboration between students to form strong networks, they will be equipped with knowledge in block chain which can help them set up their own businesses after school, Spread of Cardano block chain knowledge in the sub region, acceptance of ADA as a medium for exchange, creating a digitized economy for development.

I can say that this proposal adequately addresses the challenge  hence i have given it a 5 star rating.


I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading. I have also been an event organizer in various capacities, both through my company and on a voluntary basis for youth groups and churches.  I also have run a web development company from 1997 and have been the author of many ground breaking projects in web and Flash related projects in my country.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers  have provided ample evidence  of themselves with their skills and experience in  running various WADA initiatives.
  
 The links are sufficient. 
 
I have visited these links and contacted the relevant people
  
The proposers are well experienced and competent to do the event.

 The type and number of team members required to implement the proposal is stated.
 
 
The team structure is listed and experienced.
 
 
 The budget has   been given in detail. 
 
The budget is  reasonable to achieve the set goals. 
 
 
The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required  

 
There is no plan for additional funding  if objectives are not met. 
 
Theres a realistic timetable  to complete the work
 
The proposal gives  a sensible and conductible plan for implementation.  .
 

Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are described.   
  

The proposal has technical aspects which have been addressed 


 
The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal  
 

A piece of advice... You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise. A proposer who has considered this, would be looked on more favorably since it shows that they are prepared for various situations and eventualities


Given experience and plan presented it is  highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully
 This proposal is detailed and budget is reasonable hence I have given it a 5 star rating.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a clearly laid out roadmap with milestones  
 

 There are  Metrics such of number of students and number of schools, participants in courses, and feedback.
 
The problem has been clearly understood and solution has been given in much detail.
  
 
    The proposer has not identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties.
 
  
 
Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.


The information provided is  sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal hence I have given it a  5 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is aimed for the future and most rightly so. Disruption in technology is more easily accepted by the younger generations. Add to this the young demographic that makes up Africa, with a median age of 19.7 and one of the highest population growth in the world, educating early-on in this region should be prioritized. Metrics that China have understood earlier than most nations. This proposal also states clearly how they will execute their approach and what will be presented and also to whom. Collaboration with local education entities is a smart move for I reckon it will provide the WADA team further credentials that will make approaching their targeted school and future schools easier. All intended success metrics also fits well within the metrics of this Challenge. If goes as planned this format I reckon can easily be duplicated and implemented to various schools across the region simultaneously. Only critique I have would be the effectiveness, education early-on has it's risk, educating them in a rigid manner I fear would only cause confusion and reluctance to learn more, a current issue of Cardano which is having bite-size and easy-to-learn content. Keeping it fun would perhaps be best, but still there is no guarantee these raw new members will be onboard the Cardano revolution.
f6_assessments.q1: There is an issue with this proposal though, which is the absence of who specifically are the proposers or who will execute this program. It only states WADA the organization. Although they have already built a reputation in the community, knowing at least who is the proposer would be reassuring. WADA as a reputable entity are most likely to deliver on their intended targets but would have loved if they were to go into detail regarding roadmap and budget though. Specifically the education materials that is allocated a budget of $3000. It leaves things in the guesstimate sphere. 'What kind of education material does $3000 translate into?'. The team has also not considered any potential risk and challenge they might face, such as this being an offline event, the threat of Omicron might be a deterrence to accept or limit unknown individuals into a school environment.
f6_assessments.q2: There are general roadmaps and there are also a list of metrics but unfortunately no numerical targets attached. This makes auditing this proposal a challenge. A lot is riding on the reputation that WADA has build but being diligent consistently should also be a standard. Being reputable does not mean it is a given. The problem statement formulated correlates well with the solution given.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal concerns the education of youth in Ghana about Cardano. The problem is clearly described and explained in detail.
The solution is clearly defined, fit the challenge with a clear impact on the ecosystem in short term and long term.
Therefore, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge. I can rate the impact of this proposal with a score of 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The described proposer's information shows that the author has a long-term attachment to Catalyst, however, there is a lack of external link with sufficient information for verifying the ability of the team. The proposer needs to add verification information to show the feasibility. The budget is provided with a logical structure of items. Risk (and mitigation) is not defined.
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility and give this proposal a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a lack of external links with sufficient information for verifying the ability and experience of the team and partners (National Vocational Technical Institute, Koforidua Secondary Technical Senior High School, WADA Team Specialists). The proposer needs to add verification information to ensure transparency. The budget is provided with the structure of items, without explanation. It is necessary to supplement the basis for the calculation to facilitate the monitoring of the community. Some metrics have remained very abstract (ex: "Expected impact",...).
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability and give this proposal a score of 3

f6_assessments.q0: This project by WADA seeks to improve employment and economic prospects of young people in the Eastern Region of Ghana through a series of workshops and network building opportunities for up to 300 young people in the region. This initiative would increase the diversity of the Cardano community through directly engaging young people from the Eastern Region of Ghana, which, if successful would provide employment opportunities and economic benefit to the region and add value to the Cardano ecosystem. Locally focussed, this project could act as a pilot that has potential to scale into other emerging economies and tackle youth unemployment in other regions.
f6_assessments.q1: The WADA team have a strong track record and are highly engaged in the Cardano community, have executed previous projects. The skills on the team align with the needs of the project with a blend of formal educators, entrepreneurs and mentors within the team. The timeframe and budget is outlined in the project, with measurable deliverables including achievable targets of running 2 workshops per month to young people in the region. The budget supports access requirements that would be required including funds for food and transport as well as initial funds to open Yoroi wallets to kick-start the participant's engagement in Cardano.
f6_assessments.q2: The project is succinct, measurable and has clear deliverables. There is an evaluation matrix included to measure the overall success of the project, however this does not include specific targets or initial starting points for the community that they will engage. A suggested modification for this evaluation is to include an entry and exit survey for participants so that the knowlege and networks gained can be measured throughout the process.  Dates are not included in the timeframe.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal definitely fit into the challenge because educating the youth to raise Cardano blockchain knowledge would help to widen Catalyst community and may remain sustainable. Besides, that educating also helps to increase human resource potential for Cardano ecosystem in future, it means the proposal will add value to the Cardano system. This point is clearly stated by project's objectives and presentation's topics (centered around Cardano and Catalyst project) as well as clearly articulated in the 'Impact' section of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
In my opinion, the proposal is likely to be successfully implemented. Although the type and number of the team is missing and team qualification is decribed short and simple, the proposers provided wada website which included those information and presented the team's experience and relevant skill needed to implement the proposal.
The budget is clear and broken down into identifiable items. In my opinion, the budget is reasonable to achieve the set goals. Therefore, I rate feasibility with a score of 4.
I would recommend the proposers should consider challenges and risks relevant to the success of the implementation.
I have a question about the last item in the broken down budget: Is making Yoroi wallets for participants free? Why do we need $500 for that?
f6_assessments.q2:
I believe the progress and the success of the proposal can be sufficient to audit because the roadmap with milestone and time horizon is provided as well as succcess metrics and clear solution that address the problem.
I recommend the team should provide more detail about how to audit the  success metric 'Broad knowledge in Cardano block chain technology and ecosystem' and the metric 'Expected impact'. Making the metrics more clear to be audited easily will raise the trust of readers in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is great. The proposal has identified the problem from the challenge and geared towards its solution. The proposal when implemented would bring value to Cardano community because more people would join the community( territory of Cardano would expand). I can see that the goal of the proposal does not conflict with the challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has got an identifiable team. The team is made up of skilled and experienced members from WADA. They provided a link to their site as a proof. That's superb. The budget is stated and further broken down into identifiable items, that for me is excellent. I like the fact that the proposal has captured a plan for its implementation. 
One unique feature about this proposal is that it outlined an executive summary for the plan. That's very good.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal/team have outlined the roadmap, milestones and time horizon for the achievement of the proposal. That's great. The team have also further described the target problem. Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal are outlined.

f6_assessments.q0:
Graduate unemployment is major canker in Ghana as it has been noted in the proposal, the majority of graduates look up to the government for employment. This has the tendency of making graduate vulnerable to the whim of ruling elites. 

I think that this proposal suitably addresses the problem by educating students to explore the opportunities in Cardano/Catalyst community. This would be a helpful alternative to the status quo. The focus on the Eastern region is laudable as well and I believe this can successfully expand to other regions in Ghana with time.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has immense experience to ensure the successful implementation of project outcomes. The proposal has well-defined deliverables that are measurable to determine success. I think this event should be given the necessary support by the community as its impact would be meaningful to help transform livelihoods.
f6_assessments.q2: The team is transparent and open. The proposal has a breakdown of activities that is significant so far as the audit is concerned.

f6_assessments.q0: it is a great idea to educate students on the prospects of Cardano and will help win more into the community. you have a good plan but a sample of the educational material would be made a good impact on the proposal.   Your plan to engage those who show interest through workshops is fantastic. Evidence of a previous work you have been part of would help a lot.
f6_assessments.q1: With the support of WADA the team will well but the plan is not clear. Mentioning number of workshops in phases will not be enough. the details of which institution, as to whether permission are given or will be given, we are not sure about that.
f6_assessments.q2: your objective is to educate 300 students which is great. I expected to see this number broken down in the various phases. Also, no mention is made of the particular institutions this project seeks to educate.

f6_assessments.q0: Providing education to students about cardano and its benefits is an excellent idea. This will be helpful in enlightening the students and also increase the cardano community in Ghana. Therefore, as far as this proposal seeks to expand the cardano user base, I agree that the project will address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the WADA in the Cardano community cannot be overestimated hence their track record makes them the ideal team for this project. More importantly, the target audience is well captured and there is a well-developed timeline for the proposal. Also, there are well outlined events scheduled within specific timeline for the project and a work breakdown structure is also incorporated within the proposal. The events scheduled for the proposal will definitely increase the cardano presence in the eastern region of Ghana and also increase the number of ADA holders. Additional, the proposal also provides a detailed breakdown of the budgetary allocation for each activity the team seeks to undertake. Therefore, with the inclusion of a well-developed timelines for each event and a proper budgetary allocation, it will be very easy implementing the project successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The project provides a metric to monitor and track the progress and success of the project. For instance, the project intends to develop a database to capture the details of students who attend conferences, capture those who will remain active proposers and those who will successful create a cardano native wallet.

f6_assessments.q0: Great idea to educate college and University Students. the metrics of success are not specific: how many do you intend to reach out to and how many do you envision to join the community.
f6_assessments.q1: the proposer did not put any evidence of previous work done under WADA. the proposal mentions only the number of conferences per phase but other details are left out. A timetable capturing  the institution you wish to visit the numbers you anticipate and the budget that is associated with will be very handy.
f6_assessments.q2: the activity is set to happen in phases but the budget is bulked. Also some element of the budget needed to be explained to help in the auditing process

f6_assessments.q0: Introducing students to Cardano through educational initiatives absolutely fits into community events and is an established and effective way to leave an impression among a curious and ambitious population of young people. Affordable and effective means such as this, especially in regions of the world underserved by centralized financial institutions, represent an example of what should be encouraged in this sort of challenge. I see many reasons to be confident in this proposal, with more details below.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer is very active in Catalyst with a deep, thorough and effective history. The sum requested is both reasonable and allocated responsibly. There is no reason to believe, given the request, that the two-workshop-per-month roadmap is feasible, as every conceivable provision appears planned for. If I had a quibble: An example of a more detailed lesson plan or powerpoint from such a the workshops might have made a valuable contribution, but given how well laid-out this proposal is as it stands I don't think it was absolutely essential. Still, as someone with some pedagogical experience it always helps to see illustrative direct examples of the kind of work proposers do.
f6_assessments.q2: That partners with educational institutions are listed speaks very well for this proposal, and demonstrates a proactive approach to engaging communities and building relationships in Ghana. That success metrics are listed for evaluation also reflects well upon it, including a feedback mechanism for participation and a pledge to provide a counting of attendees to the Cardano community. These are in fact the kinds of commitments to deliverable results I wish I saw more often in proposals.

f6_assessments.q0: Good idea , but does not indicate how communication between these new participants would be kept after community event to maintain interest of new participants. This proposal looks to benefit from how much teenagers use social media but does not indicate how social metrics would be quantified. Hype beign one of the main growth factors of adpotion no indication of how proposer will market community events in the region.No mention of mentoring these new participants.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the vague description of the team and its qualifications, no evidence of name, relevant skills, and qualifications of team members was provided. In the outline of the budget, no mention of social media & marketing making this seem impossible for a buzz to be created for Cardano. No detail of how interested proposers, CA, and voters would be drafted and kept track of, which is very important in keeping track.
f6_assessments.q2: The key performance indicators (KPIs)  included but vaguely specify how social metrics will be monitored. The ability to audit this proposal needs clearer metrics that can be easily viewed to determine if the proposal is successful.

solution: Educar cerca de 300 jovens (tanto do ensino médio como do ensino superior na Região Leste, em Gana) sobre Cardano e suas oportunidades.
experience: Equipe WADA de Conselheiros Comunitários, Mentores e Educadores, Comerciantes, Empresários, Professores
